document.title: Model School Library Standards for California Public Schools, Kindergarten Through Grade Twelve

730C548561C04BB4AA241793A15F2E2B.description: Monitor one's own progress in seeking and handling information, and adapt as necessary.

EE4B8F152D004B55A7BB7A99E6521A4B.description: Read and listen to a range of literary and other creative forms of expression (e.g., poetry, drama, film, literature, visual arts).

7A7B9D78111648BBBCA81A82B6C4715E.description: Appreciate and respond to creative expressions of information:

98123A1B4C4A41098201901693D1E293.description: Organize personal digital information by using metadata, key words, and tags.

F41A88428FF741A2BEEAF83C2E4139F1.description: Use technology to communicate, share information, and collaborate with others with the same interests.

F32BC7F80FA645E88D35091B2A472F3C.description: Demonstrate and advocate legal and ethical behavior among peers, family members, and their communities when using information resources and technology.

2210005BCA7C4E1E8B80856441FFD96A.description: Contribute actively to the learning community, and participate in groups to pursue and generate information.

C15932EEBB0042D89E8C77EDF6B0451A.description: Locate information independently to satisfy curiosity.

555CD46BE6FA450993BBFFCA46A48B30.description: Select information on a topic of interest.

FC5B16D19C5D446199CFBF1A2C45BDAC.description: Demonstrate personal responsibility for lifelong learning.

B472ABE5D8124A9C95670C3ACB55D706.description: Develop strategies to focus on personal learning.

8A23624BF7B64E8AB79D2A3F942A9A64.description: Demonstrate competence and self-motivation in reading, listening, and viewing information.

DF1FCBCDB1364739877B08A05608F8E0.description: Independently read two million words annually, including a wide variety of classic and contemporary literature, magazines, newspapers, and online information.

D6759BC0B47F4AA8A0FCD679DF9BD0CC.description: Read widely and use various media for information, personal interest, and lifelong learning:

BB6959840915498F96F61D6018038369.description: Students integrate information literacy skills into all areas of learning.

932FCFAA28B5448C91F4C240D0475164.description: Construct and test hypotheses; collect, evaluate, and employ information from multiple primary and secondary sources; and apply it in oral and written presentations, using appropriate citations.

80008992717A4BF28B63052F10B54F8F.description: Use common organizational patterns, such as logic, analogy, compare and contrast, problem and solution, cause and effect, to inform or persuade.

AC04A1BFD8B549AA90633EF007D202A4.description: Draw clear and appropriate conclusions supported by evidence and examples.

2249A244B9834A3AA6F10A10FA9DCE29.description: Be aware of the impact of personal bias when interpreting information.

1CFBD8871A3A4004B60DA747AB4FD79B.description: Analyze and interpret results of experiments, surveys, and interviews, using quantitative and qualitative methods.

9D0B5BFE2DE0485D9D901DE67CDF7A3F.description: Design experiments, surveys, and interviews, individually or in a group as needed, to investigate research questions.

24D30031A3024AF8BD56B95CB8AFC4FA.description: Produce media efficiently and appropriately to communicate a message to an audience.

38AEB73AEA9541C3A254D3101FE2F67D.description: Identify capabilities and limitations of tools for organizing and using information.

DC183A15E68C4C7F98CE2F81544D55A1.description: Analyze design elements of various kinds of media productions and identify media messages that have embedded points of view.

77C631D95EFA4C519D5BF6B83B7DB965.description: Explain how meaning is conveyed in image and sound and recognize that many media messages are constructed to generate profit, influence viewers, or both.

83A30066B6344D0AA532234CCC4C0F42.description: Use information and technology creatively to answer a question, solve a problem, or enrich understanding:

0560A0C4D64147408E074373913353A9.description: Analyze information from multiple sources and identify complexities, discrepancies, and different perspectives of sources.

D77D0F2F850846C4B479793D96B4AD64.description: Draw conclusions and make informed decisions:

5B6B3F1905D7485EA51EE814B00FE91F.description: Define and defend the need for intellectual freedom.

511C68FFC15240F58227306E3A5B65E4.description: Practice strategies to protect digital devices (e.g., antivirus software, secure connections, encryption, operating-system updates).

074A23A12242450DB528538F34725674.description: Describe the privileges and responsibilities outlined in the school's (or school district's) Internet acceptable-use policy.

DEB1F587D90B438CA645BBD0547522E2.description: Use materials, equipment, and facilities responsibly and independently.

B55578CD310D4A198F92D8E3C03218DA.description: Describe the implications of criminal activities (e.g., generating viruses, hacking, identity theft, accessing illegal images).

F02747A99A2B41709844ED21FD7BB976.description: Recognize and protect the private information of oneself and others.

E949F5AB452B40C1B2F460E60EB1C431.description: Use appropriate conventions for documentation in the text, footnotes, references, and bibliographies by adhering to an acceptable format.

171B928532F348EF9FF256554380D3F6.description: Understand the differences between quoting, summarizing, and paraphrasing and apply these skills to one's own work.

8D237AC3C54D4A1ABB2F378DECA72E9D.description: Demonstrate respect for intellectual property, copyright restrictions, fair use, and public-performance rights when downloading or duplicating media.

220D837A2FA74D4F846304584546EEF4.description: Demonstrate ethical, legal, and safe use of information in print, media, and online resources:

17EFC8F0A79B49678C24971837869107.description: Understand that some areas of investigation have inadequate existing material and require a change in plan, change in topic, or original research.

2A6F8AA793E54FA49BFBF2BBAD0BA8AA.description: Review work through self-reflection, peer review, and teacher feedback to determine whether the information is sufficient and the research process was effective.

6B4588DD6B3149FEA0937F57FCABF1D4.description: Determine and use strategies for revising, improving, and updating knowledge of a subject.

834E16CA51E040F8B81B2F0BDF43BE22.description: Consider the need for additional information:

141488553C0A47F2A3B0B0760435E4FF.description: Use systematic strategies and technology tools to organize and record information(e.g., anecdotal scripting, footnotes, annotated bibliographies).

5D716E23D66C44819FE7830B1FB049E2.description: Determine whether resources are designed to persuade, educate, inform, or sell.

0ECD7333087548C493D973C0BB604D0C.description: Analyze media for purpose, message, accuracy, bias, and intended audience.

C4F0F798CC1A4228B6C52D2CE7DAC3BB.description: Identify bias and prejudice in historical interpretations.

B3E098F04EB14B17A2BBA709EEB9E665.description: Verify the authenticity of primary and secondary source information found online.

05908077CA2A4088AA7242A4D5710CF7.description: Assess the comprehensiveness, currency, credibility, authority, and accuracy of resources:

EBAE9279484641AF9A49F6239AB1049F.description: Interpret meaning from charts, maps, graphs, tables, and pictures.

08AAD945B714455F9149EDBCDA1A73F5.description: Analyze important ideas and supporting evidence in an information source by using logic and informed judgment to accept or reject information.

357FA162FBB04C93A2A38AF8981747F4.description: Evaluate online search results, demonstrating an understanding of how search engines determine rank or relevancy.

E161AD24F35C4B41A8C7D1A8AB6F49FD.description: Determine the relevance of the information:

27F1AD82EE994C36A2365C5F82C03DCA.description: Analyze the structure and format of informational text that make information accessible and usable (e.g., graphics, sequence, diagrams, illustrations, charts, maps).

15392C406D3748509FFF1910746C1B36.description: Use "pre-search" strategies to identify what should be read in depth (e.g., scan titles, headings, captions, introductions, summaries, and conclusions).

205B9FA4D0624B08B6E0178B7F989CA4.description: Understand how to access and retrieve resources from local, regional, state, and national libraries through interlibrary loan and other means.

DB2A0E3EEAF24E139074B2C441797757.description: Demonstrate proper procedures and good citizenship online.

4C3583D5B0DE4086BD02620C6983220A.description: Retrieve information in a timely, safe, and responsible manner:

728F53DC8A6C4A98B221E9B8824ECE5E.description: Demonstrate a variety of research methods used in different disciplines (e.g., the humanities, sciences, social sciences).

EA6954C25A534E119F640D2E97ACE78F.description: Use a variety of print, media, and online resources to locate information, including encyclopedias and other reference materials.

7E86847DF4B345DFAFA369776CBF349F.description: Identify, compare, and contrast the bibliographic information provided in a printed or digital book or on a Web site.

BF26EA6C4604404A9D5C88BC08E0E70B.description: Select and use appropriate tools and technology to locate resources.

5CD9270A55D54C0B86FAEADACE18AC0C.description: Identify the structural features of informational text and use the features to locate information (e.g., expository text, public documents, journal articles).

FD884C290B5840E18C12D4290750B852.description: Create and save searches and bibliographies within library catalogs and databases.

4C162329F806445A8A3A122AC08E23A9.description: Differentiate between scholarly and popular publications in print or digital format.

2D6BF0DA30D5496D87ACFD91579CFF40.description: Search for information by using both controlled vocabulary (e.g., subject headings, descriptors) and natural language.

532BF05EDD984EB09EC842005234AB35.description: Search for information by using advanced search skills (e.g., Boolean operators, adjacency, proximity, wild card symbols, truncation).

EADDE94DBD8846D09015E938D7D1A9DD.description: Use the hierarchy of a URL through successive truncations to navigate a site.

ABB953D4F8FC4EE199056ECA269F55CD.description: Search for information on Web sites by using "tags" and hierarchical directories.

DEF0B9A6C04A4901BF8A9E17B0050BCC.description: Use a variety of search engines and licensed and free databases to locate appropriate information.

39131F3F6A574DCBB37C975F01669B00.description: Identify and locate a variety of resources online and in other formats by using effective search strategies:

43B0A25922704F78A712C4B5E7CBCCFF.description: Finalize the research question or hypothesis by conducting preliminary research.

6D81CB250BE642379BC2AEA4FF39B0C4.description: Develop and present a clear thesis statement or hypothesis.

5F5FD5C0C8ED43B09E230D54599AABE1.description: Generate research questions based on interests, observations, information, stories, and issues or on an assigned topic.

A1729F59A0224B6C86F82957D18A7BF2.description: Identify topics, broaden or narrow a topic, and develop ideas to direct the focus of an inquiry.
